required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of HLX04-O in Subjects With wAMD
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I/II, Single-arm, Open-label, Multicenter Study to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of HLX04-O Administered by Intravitreal Injection in Subjects With Wet Age Related Macular Degeneration (wAMD)

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the safety, tolerability, pharmacokinetics and preliminary efficacy of HLX04-O administered every 4 weeks in participants with wet age-related macular degeneration (wAMD)

primary_outcome.description: toxicity and causality (related to or possibly related to HLX04 O) that occurs within 4 weeks after the first treatment (single administration)

primary_outcome.measure: Phase 2: Mean change of letters from baseline in the BCVA at Week 12
primary_outcome.description: Detailed Outcome Measure will be defined in the Statistical Analysis Plan

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase I: HLX04-O systemic PK parameters following IVT administration of Dose 1 and Dose 4
secondary_outcome.description: Detailed Outcome Measure will be defined in the Statistical Analysis Plan

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase 2: Mean change of letters from baseline in the BCVA over time
secondary_outcome.description: Detailed Outcome Measure will be defined in the Statistical Analysis Plan

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase 2: Proportion of patients gaining at least 15/10/5 letters in the BCVA at Week 12, 24, 36 and 48
secondary_outcome.description: Detailed Outcome Measure will be defined in the Statistical Analysis Plan

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase 2: Mean change from baseline in the total area of CNV and the total area of fluorescein leakage on fluorescein angiography (FA) at Week 12, 24 and 48
secondary_outcome.description: Detailed Outcome Measure will be defined in the Statistical Analysis Plan

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase 2: Mean change from baseline in central retina thickness (CRT) on optical coherence tomography (OCT) at Week 12, 24, 36 and 48
secondary_outcome.description: Detailed Outcome Measure will be defined in the Statistical Analysis Plan

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase 2: Change from baseline in NEI VFQ-25 scale score at Week 12, 24, and 48
secondary_outcome.description: Detailed Outcome Measure will be defined in the Statistical Analysis Plan

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase 2: Percentage and severity of ocular AEs (IVT procedure related and Investigation Medication related), non-ocular AEs; laboratory abnormalities; vital sign, physical examination abnormalities, etc.
secondary_outcome.description: Detailed Outcome Measure will be defined in the Statistical Analysis Plan

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase 2: Incidence of ADAs and NAbs against HLX04-O following IVT administration
secondary_outcome.description: Detailed Outcome Measure will be defined in the Statistical Analysis Plan

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase 2: • HLX04-O serum concentrations before Dose 1, 168 hours after Dose 1, before Dose 2, before Dose 4, 168 hours after Dose 4, before Dose 5, before Dose 8, before Dose 12 and the last visit
secondary_outcome.description: Detailed Outcome Measure will be defined in the Statistical Analysis Plan

arm_group.description: Biologic recombinant anti-VEGF humanized monoclonal antibody.

intervention.intervention_name: recombinant anti-vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF) humanized monoclonal antibody ophthalmic injection
intervention.description: 0.05mL (12.5mg/0.5mL/vial) HLX-04-O solution at a 4-week interval for intravitreal injection

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Capable to fully understand and sign the informed consent form (ICF).
2. Women or men aged ≥50 years when signing the ICF.
3. Study eye is diagnosed with neovascular age related macular degeneration and would need an intravitreal injection.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Vitreous hemorrhage in study eye within 3 months prior to dose 1.
2. Uncontrolled glaucoma
3. Equivalent spherical diopter of the study eye ≥-8D.
4. Previous extraocular or periocular surgery within 1 month prior to dose 1, or current unhealed wound, moderate or severe ulcer or history of fracture in the study eye.
5. Participated in any drug (other than vitamins and minerals) or device clinical trials within 3 months or the duration of 5 half-lives of the study drug (which is longer) prior to dose 1 and have used the test drug or received device treatment.
6. Pregnancy or lactation.
7. Men or women fail to meet both of the following ones: 1) women must have a negative serum pregnancy test result within 14 days prior to initiation of the study intervention; 2) agreement to remain abstinent (refrain from heterosexual intercourse) or use effective contraceptive methods from signed ICF to at least 6 months following the last dose of the study intervention. Effective contraceptive methods include bilateral tubal ligation, male sterilization, established physical contraception and copper intrauterine devices (IUDs).
8. Stroke or myocardial infarction within 6 months prior to dose 1, uncontrolled hypertension, etc.
9. Evidence of significant uncontrolled concomitant diseases such as cardiovascular diseases, nervous system diseases, respiratory system diseases, urinary system diseases, digestive system diseases and endocrine diseases.
10. Current treatment for active systemic infection, or history of recurrent serious infections.
11. Known active or suspected autoimmune diseases, requiring systemic immunosuppressive therapy.
12. Known allergy to any component of the study intervention or history of allergy to fluorescein or indocyanine green, any anesthetics or antimicrobial agents used during the course of the study.
13. In the Investigator's judgment, there is evidence of a disease or condition that contraindicates the use an investigational drug or that might affect interpretation of the results of the study or render the participant at high risk for treatment complications, or other conditions considered not amenable to this study.
Other protocol defined inclusion and exclusion criteria may apply.
